lines.text: Thunder. Enter the three Witches

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Where hast thou been, sister?

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Killing swine.

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: Sister, where thou?

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: A sailor's wife had chestnuts in her lap, And munch'd, and munch'd, and munch'd:-- 'Give me,' quoth I: 'Aroint thee, witch!' the rump-fed ronyon cries. Her husband's to Aleppo gone, master o' the Tiger: But in a sieve I'll thither sail, And, like a rat without a tail, I'll do, I'll do, and I'll do.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: I'll give thee a wind.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Thou'rt kind.

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: And I another.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: I myself have all the other, And the very ports they blow, All the quarters that they know I' the shipman's card. I will drain him dry as hay: Sleep shall neither night nor day Hang upon his pent-house lid; He shall live a man forbid: Weary se'nnights nine times nine Shall he dwindle, peak and pine: Though his bark cannot be lost, Yet it shall be tempest-tost. Look what I have.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Show me, show me.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Here I have a pilot's thumb, Wreck'd as homeward he did come.
Drum within

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: A drum, a drum! Macbeth doth come.

lines.speaker: all
lines.text: The weird sisters, hand in hand, Posters of the sea and land, Thus do go about, about: Thrice to thine and thrice to mine And thrice again, to make up nine. Peace! the charm's wound up.
Enter MACBETH and BANQUO

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: So foul and fair a day I have not seen.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: How far is't call'd to Forres? What are these So wither'd and so wild in their attire, That look not like the inhabitants o' the earth, And yet are on't? Live you? or are you aught That man may question? You seem to understand me, By each at once her chappy finger laying Upon her skinny lips: you should be women, And yet your beards forbid me to interpret That you are so.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Speak, if you can: what are you?

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: All hail, Macbeth! hail to thee, thane of Glamis!

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: All hail, Macbeth, hail to thee, thane of Cawdor!

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: All hail, Macbeth, thou shalt be king hereafter!

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Good sir, why do you start; and seem to fear Things that do sound so fair? I' the name of truth, Are ye fantastical, or that indeed Which outwardly ye show? My noble partner You greet with present grace and great prediction Of noble having and of royal hope, That he seems rapt withal: to me you speak not. If you can look into the seeds of time, And say which grain will grow and which will not, Speak then to me, who neither beg nor fear Your favours nor your hate.

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Hail!

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Hail!

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: Hail!

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Lesser than Macbeth, and greater.

lines.speaker: second witch
lines.text: Not so happy, yet much happier.

lines.speaker: third witch
lines.text: Thou shalt get kings, though thou be none: So all hail, Macbeth and Banquo!

lines.speaker: first witch
lines.text: Banquo and Macbeth, all hail!

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Stay, you imperfect speakers, tell me more: By Sinel's death I know I am thane of Glamis; But how of Cawdor? the thane of Cawdor lives, A prosperous gentleman; and to be king Stands not within the prospect of belief, No more than to be Cawdor. Say from whence You owe this strange intelligence? or why Upon this blasted heath you stop our way With such prophetic greeting? Speak, I charge you.
Witches vanish

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: The earth hath bubbles, as the water has, And these are of them. Whither are they vanish'd?

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Into the air; and what seem'd corporal melted As breath into the wind. Would they had stay'd!

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Were such things here as we do speak about? Or have we eaten on the insane root That takes the reason prisoner?

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Your children shall be kings.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: You shall be king.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: And thane of Cawdor too: went it not so?

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: To the selfsame tune and words. Who's here?
Enter ROSS and ANGUS

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The king hath happily received, Macbeth, The news of thy success; and when he reads Thy personal venture in the rebels' fight, His wonders and his praises do contend Which should be thine or his: silenced with that, In viewing o'er the rest o' the selfsame day, He finds thee in the stout Norweyan ranks, Nothing afeard of what thyself didst make, Strange images of death. As thick as hail Came post with post; and every one did bear Thy praises in his kingdom's great defence, And pour'd them down before him.

lines.speaker: angus
lines.text: We are sent To give thee from our royal master thanks; Only to herald thee into his sight, Not pay thee.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And, for an earnest of a greater honour, He bade me, from him, call thee thane of Cawdor: In which addition, hail, most worthy thane! For it is thine.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: What, can the devil speak true?

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: The thane of Cawdor lives: why do you dress me In borrow'd robes?

lines.speaker: angus
lines.text: Who was the thane lives yet; But under heavy judgment bears that life Which he deserves to lose. Whether he was combined With those of Norway, or did line the rebel With hidden help and vantage, or that with both He labour'd in his country's wreck, I know not; But treasons capital, confess'd and proved, Have overthrown him.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: [Aside]  Glamis, and thane of Cawdor! The greatest is behind. Thanks for your pains. Do you not hope your children shall be kings, When those that gave the thane of Cawdor to me Promised no less to them?
To ROSS and ANGUS
To BANQUO

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: That trusted home Might yet enkindle you unto the crown, Besides the thane of Cawdor. But 'tis strange: And oftentimes, to win us to our harm, The instruments of darkness tell us truths, Win us with honest trifles, to betray's In deepest consequence. Cousins, a word, I pray you.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: [Aside] Two truths are told, As happy prologues to the swelling act Of the imperial theme.--I thank you, gentlemen. Cannot be ill, cannot be good: if ill, Why hath it given me earnest of success, Commencing in a truth? I am thane of Cawdor: If good, why do I yield to that suggestion Whose horrid image doth unfix my hair And make my seated heart knock at my ribs, Against the use of nature? Present fears Are less than horrible imaginings: My thought, whose murder yet is but fantastical, Shakes so my single state of man that function Is smother'd in surmise, and nothing is But what is not.
Aside

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Look, how our partner's rapt.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: [Aside]  If chance will have me king, why, chance may crown me, Without my stir.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: New horrors come upon him, Like our strange garments, cleave not to their mould But with the aid of use.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: [Aside]                Come what come may, Time and the hour runs through the roughest day.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Worthy Macbeth, we stay upon your leisure.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Give me your favour: my dull brain was wrought With things forgotten. Kind gentlemen, your pains Are register'd where every day I turn The leaf to read them. Let us toward the king. Think upon what hath chanced, and, at more time, The interim having weigh'd it, let us speak Our free hearts each to other.

lines.speaker: banquo
lines.text: Very gladly.

lines.speaker: macbeth
lines.text: Till then, enough. Come, friends.
Exeunt
